content.description:
Right off the ground is a hard crux, the starting holds feel very small, luckily the feet are big. The jug rail is really fun, because you can go feet first, swing them behind, or smear on bad edges. Then you drop into the start of

A Bit of Eden

, and fire those moves. All in all, this is a stellar problem.
content.location:
Start at the left of the rail where it begins on some small holds. Pull off the ground and traverse the rail into

A Bit of Eden

. This is a very fun left-to-right traverse with a couple of big moves at the end.

content.description: Start at the large jug left of the little tree sprouting from the boulder. Move out left to a hold just over the lip the fun move up to a sidepull with your right. From there, go up to some good holds to top out.

Hypersex is likely my favorite problem I've sent at the Pool of Plenty. If it wasn't for a slight sand factor with the start holds, I would give this a classic rating.

Sit start with hands matched on the jug feature. From there, hit the seam on the shelf with a left, heel down, cross over with the right, swing (crux?, dab factor), campus traverse further left down the shelf, stick a left hand bump on the arete, make a big move to a right hand pinch (crux?), and top it out.

The problem shares the same start as

A Bit of Eden

and finishes up on

Left Branch

.
content.protection: A few pads should be enough. The landing is very good, but the problem traverses a fair amount of ground.
content.location: This ascends the south face of Tree of Life.

content.description: Sit start matched on the jug. From there, stick a right hand pocket, place a left heel hook, gain a left hand sidepull, bump through a right hand sloper to a palm-pinch, gain the lip with the left hand, hit the jug with the right hand, and use the bumps to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. A spotter would be nice as well. The landing is good, but there are some rocks behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the center of Tree of Life's south face.

content.description:
Start on a good left hand bulb and your right hand beside it on a slightly sloping crimp. Move up to the bad pocket then the side pull. Follow the crimps to the lip and make a big move to the glorious hold on top.

Heel hooks are your friends going upward.
content.protection: A few pads and spotters might be good if you're like me. There's a huge rock on the right side of the problem that gave us issue on more than one occasion.
content.location: Keep walking past Poe Boulder into the boulderfield. The route is on the right hand side of the boulder with the large rock just a bit to the right of the sit start.
